title: How to Deploy Enterprise Cassandra on Amazon EKS with DataStax Mission Control
description:
In this video, Aaron Ploetz walks you through the process of building an Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) cluster and deploying Cassandra using DataStax Mission Control. You'll learn how to set up your cluster with eksctl, configure nodes and storage, set up S3 buckets, and install Mission Control to manage and observe your Cassandra infrastructure.

Topics covered include:

â€¢ Prerequisites: AWS CLI, eksctl, kubectl setup
â€¢ Creating an EKS cluster and node groups
â€¢ Configuring IAM policies and node groups for optimal setup
â€¢ Setting up S3 buckets for metrics and logs
â€¢A dding storage classes and persistent volume setup
â€¢ Deploying and configuring DataStax Mission Control for Cassandra management
â€¢ Accessing Mission Control through a local port forward

ðŸ”— Learn more about DataStax Mission Control: https://www.datastax.com/products/mission-control

Whether you're new to Amazon EKS or experienced with Kubernetes, this step-by-step guide will help you deploy Cassandra on Amazon EKS and manage it seamlessly using DataStax Mission Control.

Chapters:
00:00:00 Introduction
00:01:17 Creating an EKS cluster
00:03:00 Create 2nd, managed node group
00:04:44 Add EKSAdmin policy to IAM principal
00:05:34 Install EKS Pod Identity add-on
00:06:13 Enable the AWS OpenID Connect provider
00:06:43 Label database nodes with "database" role
00:08:09 Define S3 access policy
00:09:25 Attach policy to EBS CSI Driver role 
00:09:53 Create S3 buckets 
00:11:25 Install EBS CSI driver add-on
00:13:29 Define additional storage type(s)
00:14:25 Install Mission Control with KOTS
00:15:42 Upload Mission Control license file 
00:16:16 Mission Control configuration 
00:19:22 Install Cert Manager
00:21:01 Rerun pre-flight check & deploy
_________

Additional Resources:
- DataStax Developer Hub: https://datastax.com/devs
- DataStax Blog: https://www.datastax.com/blog/technical-how-tos
- Langflow: https://langflow.datastax.com
- Astra DB: https://astra.datastax.com
____________________

Stay in
